languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_create_widget
languageModelTools.userDescription: Create a Mendix pluggable widget from a natural language description
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Creates a Mendix pluggable widget with SMART INTERVIEWING. Asks ALL required questions: company, author, work folder, Mendix project, toolbox category, icon. Remembers preferences for future use. Use when user wants to create/build/generate a Mendix widget.

description.description: Natural language description of the widget to create. Example: 'A status badge that shows red/yellow/green based on an enum value'

answers.description: Answers to interview questions. Fields: widgetName (PascalCase), company (e.g. blueprintmx), author (your name), workFolder (path), mendixProject (path or 'skip'), toolboxCategory (Display/Input/Data/Container/Visualization), iconPath (path or 'default'), confirm (boolean)

languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_convert_tsx
languageModelTools.userDescription: Convert an existing React/TSX component into a Mendix pluggable widget
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Converts an existing React/TSX component into a Mendix pluggable widget. Analyzes the component's props and events, creates a Mendix wrapper, and builds the widget. Use this when the user wants to convert, wrap, or transform a React component into a Mendix widget.

tsxPath.description: Path to the TSX/React component file to convert

answers.description: Answers to interview questions including widgetName, workFolder, mendixProject, toolboxCategory, iconPath, wrapOriginal, confirm

languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_fix_errors
languageModelTools.userDescription: Analyze and fix Mendix widget build errors
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Analyzes Mendix widget build errors and suggests fixes using learned patterns and research. Use this when the user has TypeScript, React, or Mendix SDK errors in their widget code.

errorMessage.description: The error message or build output to analyze

widgetPath.description: Optional path to the widget folder for context

languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_research
languageModelTools.userDescription: Research Mendix widget patterns using Beast Mode exhaustive search
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Performs exhaustive 6-tier research on Mendix widget patterns. Use this when the user needs to understand how to implement a specific widget feature, pattern, or solve a complex widget problem. Searches official docs, GitHub, npm, forums, and more.

topic.description: The topic to research. Example: 'drag and drop in widgets', 'chart visualization patterns', 'data grid implementation'

languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_list_templates
languageModelTools.userDescription: List available pre-built Mendix widget templates
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Lists all available pre-built widget templates with their properties and events. Use this when the user wants to see what templates are available or wants to use a template as a starting point.

category.description: Optional category filter: Display, Input, Data, Container, Visualization

languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_deploy
languageModelTools.userDescription: Deploy a built widget to a Mendix project
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Deploys a built Mendix widget (.mpk file) to a Mendix project's widgets folder. Use this when the user wants to deploy, install, or copy a widget to their Mendix project.

widgetPath.description: Path to the widget folder or .mpk file

mendixProjectPath.description: Path to the Mendix project folder (containing .mpr file)

languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_show_patterns
languageModelTools.userDescription: Show the self-learning nucleus - patterns learned from building widgets
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Shows learned patterns from the self-learning nucleus including error fixes, best practices, and SDK API patterns. Use this when the user asks about what the tool has learned, wants to see patterns, or asks about the nucleus.

languageModelTools.name: mendix-widget_status
languageModelTools.userDescription: Show Mendix Widget Agent version, configuration, and status
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Shows the status of the Mendix Widget Agent including version, configuration, learned patterns count, and knowledge base status. Use this when the user asks about the tool's status, version, or configuration.

commands.title: Mendix Widget: Set Mendix Project Path

mendixWidget.defaultCompany.description: Default company identifier for widgets (e.g., blueprintmx, acme)

mendixWidget.defaultMendixProject.description: Default Mendix project path for widget deployment

mendixWidget.autoInstallDependencies.description: Automatically run npm install after generating a widget

mendixWidget.autoBuild.description: Automatically build the widget after generation

mendixWidget.autoDeploy.description: Automatically deploy to Mendix project after successful build

mendixWidget.beastModeEnabled.description: Enable Beast Mode exhaustive research for complex widgets
